text: I write this review to serve as a warning to anyone that's looking for a good krill oil to avoid this one like the plague. This krill oil has given me severe diarrhea for the past ten days. I'm still trying to recover from it. Not only were there the usual problems associated with diarrhea but also the sleepless nights from the constant stomach ache with bathroom sessions lasting an hour and a half. I should be totally clear of it in about another week. Don't think I tried to get back to normal without medicine. I've been using Imodium  and it is working. I thought it might be just me so my girlfriend, who is an RN, tried it once and started having gas problems. So it's not just me. I do not wish this on anyone else. Please heed this warning and try a different brand. I usually don't like writing bad reviews but I like helping people more. Please, stay away at all costs.
title: I am living through the worst case of DIARRHEA I have ever had in my life.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 September 2022

text: Bought this hoping for a step up in quality, and therefore decrease in pills taken, from my regular store bought Mega-Red. It might possibly be better in some respects, but I didn't see any improvement. (Literally see, because I take this for my eyes after laser surgery. Fish oil helps tremendously with dry eyes and occasional blurriness.)However what I DID see... or rather smell... is that the pills themselves smell strongly. They smell more like straight fish oil capsules, and less like the Mega-Red capsules. I also noticed more "fish burps" on par with fish oil capsules. In addition, I noticed that shortly after I started taking these, other things started smelling more strongly, including urine and other female secretions. I had never noticed that last issue with any other pills like this- Fish Oil, Omega 3 capsules, Mega-Red- in the 1.5 yrs I've been taking them. I stopped using them because it was a significant enough change to bother me.  Everybody is different, and every body is different... so just an FYI.
title: Fishy Smell- from Capsules and otherwise.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 November 2017

In addition, since it takes 2 pills to make the advertised 1000mg dose, the pills are quite expensive at 21 cents ea. compared to Sam's club which sells similar 500mg softgels for 14 cents each. text: 1. It suggests that there is DHA+EPA = 1000mg, where in fact DHA = 80mg and EPA = 120mg, 80+120 = 200. 200 =/= 1000mg.2. The numbers don't add up. Am I missing something? The content totals add to 800g and then there is 1000mg of oil. Is the 200mg water in fact? If yes, no one is putting that on the label. Another way to trick buyers.My advice, since the only reason people would want to supplement with Omega 3 is DHA and this product has very little of it, just don't buy this. Get OMega 3s (plenty of them) from flax seeds and get algae based DHA that is superior to krill one anyways and there will be more of it per serving.I give 1 star reviews only when a company wants to trick buyers.. I will change this review if someone enlightens me with where I went wrong here.Thank you.
title: There is only 80g of DHA!! and 120g of EPA. Not dha + epa = 1000g as the front label says.
